page.title: 09SHOPPING IN MITCHELDEAN
page.content: There are about a dozen shops in Mitcheldean, several of them grocers and general stores. There are also two butchers, a shoe shop, a dress shop, a bread shop, newsagent and a fish and chip shop. There is a Post Office and a bank open 3 days per week. Mitcheldean lacks both a chemist and a hardware store, but both are found in Drybrook. Most people seemed happy with the local shops, and used them quite frequently. Mitcheldean shops close on Saturday afternoons, when many people go shopping in larger towns. A survey amongst a group of children at Mitcheldean Primary School showed that Gloucester was the most popular shopping centre for about 75 per cent of the families, with the remainder choosing the smaller, but closer towns of Cinderford and Ross-on-Wye in Herefordshire.
